benefits.title: Functional cultures and health benefits
benefits.summary: Probiotics like Lactobacillus acidophilus, Bifidobacterium spp., and L. casei can provide antimutagenic effects, anticarcinogenic properties, improved lactose metabolism, reduced serum cholesterol, and stimulated immune systems.

benefits.title: Prebiotics and probiotics: are they functional foods?
benefits.summary: Probiotics can alleviate lactose intolerance, enhance immunity, and reduce the risk of rotavirus-induced diarrhea and colon cancer.
benefits.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

benefits.title: Cholesterol-Lowering Effects of Probiotics and Prebiotics: A Review of in Vivo and in Vitro Findings
benefits.summary: Probiotics and prebiotics may have cholesterol-lowering effects, improving lipid profiles and increasing HDL-cholesterol.

benefits.title: An overview of the last advances in probiotic and prebiotic field
benefits.summary: Probiotics and prebiotics have potential health benefits such as treatment of infectious diseases, relief of chronic bowel inflammation, immunomodulation, lowering cholesterol, decreased risk of colon cancer, improved lactose digestion, and reducing allergies.

benefits.title: Probiotics, Prebiotics and Immunomodulation of Gut Mucosal Defences: Homeostasis and Immunopathology
benefits.summary: Probiotics and prebiotics can normalize gut microbiota, potentially benefiting individuals with inflammatory bowel disease, colorectal cancer, and hypersensitivity.

benefits.title: Effect of Probiotics/Prebiotics on Cattle Health and Productivity
benefits.summary: Probiotics/prebiotics can modulate the balance and activities of the gastrointestinal microbiota, which is beneficial to the host animal and has been used as functional foods.

benefits.title: Human gut microbiota and its relationship to health and disease.
benefits.summary: Probiotics are used in the clinical prevention or treatment of gastrointestinal tract disorders and metabolic syndrome.

benefits.title: The impact of probiotics and prebiotics on the immune system
benefits.summary: Probiotics and prebiotics may directly modulate immune function and influence inflammatory diseases.

benefits.title: Roles of Probiotics and Prebiotics in Colon Cancer Prevention: Postulated Mechanisms and In-vivo Evidence
benefits.summary: Probiotics and prebiotics have shown encouraging outcomes in preventing colon cancer, mainly due to their antimicrobial effects, antimutagenic properties, and alteration of tumor differentiation processes.

benefits.title: Probiotics and prebiotics: prospects for public health and nutritional recommendations
benefits.summary: Probiotics and prebiotics can contribute to the health of the general population by improving colonizing microbiota.
benefits.journal: Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences

side effects.title: A systematic review of the safety of probiotics
side effects.summary: Probiotics can cause sepsis, fungemia, and gastrointestinal ischemia, especially in critically ill patients and those with immune-compromised complexity.

side effects.title: Effect of different probiotic preparations on anti-Helicobacter pylori therapy-related side effects: a parallel group, triple blind, placebo-controlled study
side effects.summary: Probiotic supplementation significantly lowers the incidence of diarrhea and taste disturbance during anti-H. pylori therapy, improving tolerability.

side effects.title: Risk and safety of probiotics.
side effects.summary: Probiotics are generally safe for most populations, but theoretical risks include systemic infections, deleterious metabolic activities, excessive immune stimulation, gene transfer, and gastrointestinal side effects.
side effects.journal: Clinical infectious diseases : an official publication of the Infectious Diseases Society of America

side effects.title: The Effect of Probiotic Plus Prebiotic Supplementation on the Tolerance and Efficacy of Helicobacter Pylori Eradication Quadruple Therapy: a Randomized Prospective Double Blind Controlled Trial
side effects.summary: Probiotic plus prebiotic supplementation improves the eradication rate of Helicobacter pylori and reduces side effects like diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, and anorexia.
side effects.journal: Middle East Journal of Digestive Diseases

side effects.title: Safety aspects of probiotic products
side effects.summary: Probiotics may theoretically cause systemic infections, deleterious metabolic activities, excessive immune stimulation, and gene transfer.

side effects.title: Tolerance of probiotics and prebiotics.
side effects.summary: Probiotics may cause infections, deleterious metabolic activities, excessive immune stimulation, and gene transfer.

side effects.title: Clinical Applications of Probiotic Bacteria
side effects.summary: Probiotic bacteria are applied to balance disturbed intestinal microflora and related dysfunctions of the gastrointestinal tract, treating conditions like acute rotavirus diarrhea, lactose maldigestion, constipation, colonic disorders, and food allergy.

side effects.title: HEALTH EFFECTS OF PROBIOTICS AND PREBIOTICS. A LITERATURE REVIEW ON HUMAN STUDIES
side effects.summary: Probiotics can be regarded as safe, but prebiotics like fructans may cause dose-dependent gastrointestinal side-effects.

side effects.title: Safety of Probiotics
side effects.summary: Probiotics may cause systemic infections, deleterious metabolic activities, adjuvant side effects, immunomodulation, and gene transfer.

side effects.title: Assessment of the Risk of Probiotics in Terms of the Food Safety and Human Health
side effects.summary: Probiotic side effects include gastrointestinal disorders, respiratory tract infections, allergic reactions, and severe medical conditions.
side effects.journal: Health and Safety Aspects of Food Processing Technologies

dosage.title: Clinical effects and gut microbiota changes of using probiotics, prebiotics or synbiotics in inflammatory bowel disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis
dosage.summary: The dose of 10 10 –10 12 CFU/day may be a reference range for using probiotics to relieve IBD.

dosage.title: Probiotics as an effective therapeutic approach in alleviating depression symptoms: an umbrella meta-analysis.
dosage.summary: Probiotic supplementation significantly reduced depression symptoms with dosage of >10  109 CFU for >8 weeks.
dosage.journal: Critical reviews in food science and nutrition

dosage.title: Effect of synbiotics on intestinal microflora and digestive enzyme activities in rats.
dosage.summary: Low and high dosages of probiotics and prebiotics mixture significantly improved the intestinal tract ecosystem by increasing the probiotics population and digestive enzyme activities in rats.

dosage.title: Probiotics reduce symptoms of antibiotic use in a hospital setting: a randomized dose response study.
dosage.summary: The tested four strain probiotic combination (HOWARU(®) Restore) lowers the risk of antibiotic-associated diarrhea, Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea, and gastrointestinal symptoms in a dose-dependent manner in adult in-patients.

dosage.title: The perinatal use of probiotics, prebiotics, and synbiotics for the primary prevention of allergic diseases in children: A systematic review
dosage.summary: Probiotics started during the third trimester of pregnancy and continued for the first three months of life, administered as a mixture of different species in the amount of 109 to 1010 cfu/day, reduce the incidence of atopic dermatitis in children.

dosage.title: Safety evaluation for multispecies probiotics in a 28- day feeding study in Sprague-Dawley rats
dosage.summary: The tested probiotic dosages in this study were 2,000 mg/kg body weight, 4,000 mg/kg body weight, and 6,000 mg/kg body weight, with no significant differences in safety observed.

dosage.title: Effect of Psychobiotics on Psychometric Tests and Inflammatory Markers in Major Depressive Disorder: Meta-Analysis of Randomized Controlled Trials with Meta-Regression
dosage.summary: The dosage ranged between 1  109 to 2  1010 colony forming units (CFU)/day.

dosage.title: Efficacy of an Encapsulated Probiotic Bifidobacterium infantis 35624 in Women with Irritable Bowel Syndrome
dosage.summary: B. infantis 35624 at a dose of 1  108 cfu significantly relieves many symptoms of IBS, making it stable and convenient to use.

dosage.title: A critical evaluation of the factors affecting the survival and persistence of beneficial bacteria in healthy adults.
dosage.summary: Dosage recommendations for probiotics by regulatory agencies are lower than that required for a strain to survive, persist, and be efficacious in the gut.

dosage.title: A prospective randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, dose-response relationship study to investigate efficacy of fructo-oligosaccharides (FOS) on human gut microflora
dosage.summary: FOS consumption increased the relative abundance of Bifidobacterium and Lactobacillus, with higher dosages promoting selective proliferation of Lactobacillus.
